result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly D Bruce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Statutory costs assessed. Defendant must write a sincere apology to victim by the end of the summer and provide a copy to the Court. Provide this Court a paper, no longer than 5 typed pages, double spaced, as to what alternatives defendant plans to use when someone confronts him with vulgar language and what techniques defendant will use to deal with that situation.
to serve the under privileged in Racine.

Defendant Kelly D Bruce in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
The State recomends w/held sent - 12 mos prob; no violent contact with victim, counseling, FT emp/school = FT, no alc/cs-UA's, $100 + cc, 60 days RCJ - STAYED.
Defense is asking for a straight fine. Defense is asking for expungement either after one year or after probation.

BTC: $200.00 + cc, DNA costs. FTP - 2 mos RCJ. 40 hours CSW to under privileged in Racine. Must write a sincere apology to brother by the end of summer and provide a copy to the Court. Provide to this court a paper no longer than 5 pages, typed - double spaced as to what alternatives deft plans on using when someone confronts deft with vulger language and what techniquest deft will use to deal with same. Matter may be expunged if deft is compliant with all the tasks set forth by the Court.  Review hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
